qas.question: On what date was Comcast's purchase of controlling interest in NBCUniversal reported?
What did Comcast pay for their stake in NBC?

answers.text: $6.5 billion in cash and $7.3 billion in programming

qas.question: How did the FCC vote approval of the Comcast-NBC deal?
On what date was the sale finally completed?
On what date did Comcast buy out the remaining stake of General Electric in NBC?
How much did Comcast pay to Vivendi?
The FCC denied the deal by what vote?
What did GE add to their logo in December?
When did GE announce it planned to buy out Comcast's interest?

plausible_answers.text: $6.5 billion in cash and $7.3 billion in programming

qas.question: How much did Comcast pay for the remaining 49%?

context: Following a tentative agreement on by December 1, on <a0_0>December 3, 2009<a0_0/>, the parties announced that Comcast would buy a controlling 51% stake in NBCUniversal for <a1_0><b9_0>$6.5 billion in cash and $7.3 billion in programming<b9_0/><a1_0/>. GE would take over the remaining 49% stake in NBCUniversal, using <b5_0>$5.8 billion<b5_0/> to buy out Vivendi's 20% minority stake in NBCUniversal. On January 18, 2011, the FCC approved the deal by a vote of <a2_0><b6_0>4 to 1<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The sale was completed on <a3_0>January 28, 2011<a3_0/>. In late December 2012, Comcast added <b7_0>the NBC peacock symbol<b7_0/> to their new logo. On <b8_0>February 12, 2013<b8_0/>, Comcast announced an intention to acquire the remaining 49% of General Electric's interest in NBCUniversal, which Comcast completed on <a4_0>March 19, 2013<a4_0/>.
